definition: to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to cover up/to close/to surprise
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)

sentences.english: The two women leaned upon the wrought-iron window rail in the shadow of the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 兩個女人在窗簾的遮掩下，把胳膊肘支在鐵欄杆上。

sentences.english: It's better to give bad news honestly than to try to sugarcoat it.
sentences.chinese: 誠實地公佈壞消息要好過遮遮掩掩。

sentences.english: A night of depth, stretched to the horizon of the curtain of night is covering up my line of sight thickly.
sentences.chinese: 夜已深，一望無垠的夜幕厚厚實實地遮掩着我的視線。

sentences.english: Love Your Belly Pose to emphasize your belly, not hide it.
sentences.chinese: 喜歡上你的肚子吧，重視它，別遮遮掩掩的。

sentences.english: They are also all thinly veiled self-portraits.
sentences.chinese: 他們也都幾乎沒有遮掩的自畫像。

sentences.english: The secrecy used to create the Manifesto has generated some unfriendly reactions around the web.
sentences.chinese: 宣言的遮遮掩掩在網上引起了一些很不友好的反應。

sentences.english: Per haps she feels embarrassed to used white gauze cloak to live then half face.
sentences.chinese: 也許她覺得難堪於是便用白紗遮掩住了一半臉。

sentences.english: Layered looks are more than just about covering up.
sentences.chinese: 多層看起來不僅僅是爲了遮掩。

sentences.english: Perhaps she feels embarrassed to used white gauze cloak to live then half face.
sentences.chinese: 也許她覺得尷尬於是便用白紗遮掩住了一半臉。

sentences.english: In time, the foul odor of Roman decadence would grow harder to disguise.
sentences.chinese: 時日一到，羅馬矯飾的頹廢氣味終將難以遮掩。

sentences.english: Iwoulve decided to come clean on the incident.
sentences.chinese: 我決議確定毫不遮掩地將那件事全講進去。

sentences.english: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
sentences.chinese: 他雖用詭詐遮掩自己的怨恨，他的邪惡必在會中顯露。

sentences.english: This country's affection is overwhelming and furtive.
sentences.chinese: 這個國度的愛勢不可擋卻又遮遮掩掩。

sentences.english: We conceal our feelings and desires in the head with untidy hair.
sentences.chinese: 人的七情六慾，都隱藏在亂髮遮掩的腦袋裏。

sentences.english: And fogs are veiling the sun";
Hell is naked before him, and there is no covering for destruction.
sentences.chinese: 陰府在他前面顯露，死域也沒有遮掩。

definition: to hide/to cover (one's tracks)
to shelter/to shelter from
hidden/covered/concealed
to cover up/to conceal/to mask/to gloss over
to cover/to hide from view/to obstruct or block/defilade (military)
to cover (up)/to block/to obstruct/to shade
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to become visible/to reveal
to disappear/to hide
to expose (to the air, light etc)/to leave uncovered/exposure
faintly discernible (idiom)
to appear/to come out in the open
to expose/to reveal/to lay bare/also pr. [pu4 lu4]
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to express/to exhibit
to cover all at one glance (idiom)/a panoramic view
